line.words: Tradizioni di compleanni – “Zeena” e Nasi Grassi

subtitle.line: Birthday Traditions – ‘Zeena’ and Greasy Noses
Verjaardagstradities – ‘zeena’s’ en vette neuzen
Fødselsdag og tradition – “Zeena” og fedtede næser
Birthday Traditions – ‘Zeena’ and Greasy Noses

line.words: Oggi è il compleanno di Fatima. Ha nove anni.

subtitle.line: Today is Fatima’s Birthday. She is 9 years old.
Vandaag is Fatima jarig. Ze is 9 jaar geworden.
I dag er det Fatimas fødselsdag. Hun bliver 9 år.
Today is Fatima’s Birthday. She is 9 years old.

line.words: A scuola nella classe di Fatima c’è una tradizione. Quando c’è il compleanno di qualcuno, si canta “Tanti Auguri”. Ecco come cantono…

subtitle.line: In Fatima’s class at school the tradition is to sing ‘happy birthday’ when it is someone’s birthday. This is how they sing…
In Fatima’s klas is het traditie om ‘Lang zal ze leven’ te zingen wanneer er iemand jarig is. Dat liedje gaat zo…
I Fatimas klasse er der tradition for at synge “happy birthday”, når nogen fylder år. Sådan synger de:
In Fatima’s class at school the tradition is to sing ‘happy birthday’ when it is someone’s birthday. This is how they sing…

line.words: “Tanti auguri a te, tanti auguri a te, tanti auguri cara Fatima, tanti auguri a te”

subtitle.line: ‘Happy Birthday to you, Happy Birthday to you, Happy Birthday dear Fatima, Happy Birthday to you.’
‘Lang zal ze leven, lang zal ze leven, lang zal ze leven in de gloria. In de gloria, in de gloria.’
‘Happy Birthday to you, Happy Birthday to you, Happy Birthday dear Fatima, Happy Birthday to you.’
‘Happy Birthday to you, Happy Birthday to you, Happy Birthday dear Fatima, Happy Birthday to you.’

line.words: Il professore di Fatima si chiama Signore Waddle. È un bravo professore. Un professore molto bravo. Infatti è un professore fantastico, un professore magico.

subtitle.line: Fatima´s teacher is called Mr Waddle. He is a good teacher. A very good teacher. In fact he is a fantastic teacher, a magical teacher.
Fatima´s leraar heet meester Jaap. Hij is een goede leraar. Een heel goede leraar. Hij is zelfs een fantastische leraar, een magische leraar.
Fatimas lærer hedder Mr Waddle. Han er en god lærer. En rigtig god lærer. Faktisk er han en fantastisk lærer, en magisk lærer.
Fatima´s teacher is called Mr Waddle. He is a good teacher. A very good teacher. In fact he is a fantastic teacher, a magical teacher.

line.words: Lyrics go here
“Se fossi il tuo compleanno, cosa regolaresti?” chiede ai bambini uno ad uno.

subtitle.line: ‘If it was your birthday, what would you like to get as a present?’ he asks the children one by one.
‘Stel dat je jarig was, wat zou je dan als cadeautje willen?’ vraagt hij de kinderen.
“Hvis det var din fødselsdag, hvad ville du så ønske dig?”, spørger han børnene en efter en.
‘If it was your birthday, what would you like to get as a present?’ he asks the children one by one.

line.words: “Per il mio compleanno mi piacerebbe un pallone perchè è divertente!” dice Thomas. “Per il mio compleanno mi piacerebbe una bambola perchè è grande” dice Hannah.

subtitle.line: ‘For my Birthday I would like a football because it’s fun!’ says Thomas.‘For my Birthday I would like a doll because it’s great!’ says Hannah.
‘Ik zou graag een voetbal willen, want dat is leuk!’ zegt Thomas.‘Ik zou graag een pop willen, want dat is leuk!’ zegt Hanneke.

“Til min fødselsdag ønsker jeg mig en fordbold, fordi det er sjovt at spille!”, siger Thomas.”Til min fødselsdag ønsker jeg mig en dukke, for den er dejlig”, siger Hannah.”Til min fødselsdag ønsker jeg mig en drage, for den er fremragende”, siger Louis.
‘For my Birthday I would like a football because it’s fun!’ says Thomas.‘For my Birthday I would like a doll because it’s great!’ says Hannah.

line.words: “Per il mio compleanno mi piacerebbe un acquilone perchè è eccellente” dice Louis.

subtitle.line: ‘Ik zou graag een vlieger willen want dat is leuk!’ zegt Louis.
For my Birthday I would like a kite because it’s excellent!’ says Louis.
For my Birthday I would like a kite because it’s excellent!’ says Louis.

line.words: “Secondo me un pallone è più divertente che un acquilone” dice Dean. “Secondo me una bambola è noiosa ma più divertente che un pallone” dice Rebecca.

subtitle.line: ‘In my opinion a football is more fun than a kite’ says Dean.‘In my opinion a doll is boring, but more fun than a football’ says Rebecca.
‘Ik vind een voetbal leuker dan een vlieger’ zegt Danny.‘Ik vind een pop saai, maar leuker dan een voetbal’ zegt Rebecca.
“Efter min mening er en fodbold sjovere end en drage”, siger Dean.”Efter min mening er en dukke kedlig, men sjovere end en fodbold”, siger Rebecca.
‘In my opinion a football is more fun than a kite’ says Dean.‘In my opinion a doll is boring, but more fun than a football’ says Rebecca.

line.words: Signore Waddle si piega in avanti. Lo fa cosi quando sta per fare qualcosa incredibile.

subtitle.line: Mr Waddle leans forward. He does this when he is going to do something amazing.
Meester Jaap leunt voorover. Hij doet dit altijd als hij iets geweldigs gaat doen.
Mr Waddle læner sig frem. Det gør han, når han skal til at lave noget overraskende.
Mr Waddle leans forward. He does this when he is going to do something amazing.

line.words: “Compleanni hanno un significato molto più importante. Facciamo un giro. Un giro attorno al mondo di compleanni” dice. “Fatima – vieni e scegli un posto al mappamondo brillante.”

subtitle.line: ‘Birthdays are much more than just presents. Let me take you on a journey. A journey around the world of Birthdays’ he says.‘Fatima – come and choose a place on the glowing globe.’
‘Jarig zijn gaat om veel meer dan alleen cadeautjes. Laat me jullie meenemen op een reis. Een reis om de wereld van verjaardagen’ zegt hij. ‘Fatima – kies een plaats op de gloeibol’.
“Fødselsdage er meget mere end bare gaver. Lad mig tage jer med på en rejse. En rejse rundt i en fødselsdagsverden”, siger han.”Fatima – kom og vælg et sted på den glødende globus”.
‘Birthdays are much more than just presents. Let me take you on a journey. A journey around the world of Birthdays’ he says.‘Fatima – come and choose a place on the glowing globe.’

line.words: Il mappamondo brillante di Signore Waddle è una macchina che permette a tutti di andare a qualsiasi parte del mondo. Fatima indica con il dito – e sceglie Argentina.

subtitle.line: Mr Waddle’s glowing globe is a magical machine that lets the class go anywhere in the world. Fatima points her finger – and chooses Argentina.
De gloeibal van meester Jaap is een tovermachine die de klas overal ter wereld naartoe laat gaan. Fatima wijst met haar vinger – en kiest Argentinië.
Mr Waddles glødende globus er en magisk maskine, som lader klassen komme et hvilket som helst sted hen I verden. Fatima peger – og vælger Argentina.
Mr Waddle’s glowing globe is a magical machine that lets the class go anywhere in the world. Fatima points her finger – and chooses Argentina.

line.words: L’aula lampeggia – e all’improvviso! - sono trasportati ad Argentina.

subtitle.line: The classroom flashes – kazam – and they are transported to Argentina.
Het klaslokaal flikkert – hocus pocus pilatus pas – en ze zijn in Argentinië.
Det blinker i klasseværelset – kazam – og de kommer til Argentina.
The classroom flashes – kazam – and they are transported to Argentina.

line.words: “Qui in Argentina si festeggia i compleanni in modo diverso. Il lobo dell’orecchio del ragazzo o della ragazza viene tirato per ogni anno del suo compleanno.” Dolcemente Sam tira il lobo dell’orecchio di Fatima nove volte -

subtitle.line: ‘Here in Argentina, we celebrate Birthdays by pulling the earlobes of the boy or girl for each year of their birthday.’ Sam gently pulls Fatima’s earlobe 9 times –
‘Hier in Argentinië vieren we verjaardagen door aan de oorlellen van de jongen of het meisje te trekken, één keer voor elk jaar.’ Sam trekt voorzichtig 9 keer aans Fatima’s oorlel –
“Her i Argentina fejrer vi fødselsdag ved at hive i øreflippen på drengen eller pigen lige så mange gange, som de fylder”. Sam hiver forsigtigt i Fatimas øreflip 9 gange –
‘Here in Argentina, we celebrate Birthdays by pulling the earlobes of the boy or girl for each year of their birthday.’ Sam gently pulls Fatima’s earlobe 9 times –

line.words: “Dove andiamo adesso?” dice Signore Waddle. “Scegli tu Sam”. Sam indica a Canada.

subtitle.line: ‘Now where?’ Says Mr Waddle. ‘You choose, Sam.’ Sam points to Canada.
‘Waar gaan we nu naartoe?’ vraagt meester Jaap. ‘Kies jij maar, Sam.’ Sam kiest Canada.
“Hvor skal vi så hen?”, siger Mr Waddle. ”Du vælger, Sam. Sam peger på Canada.
‘Now where?’ Says Mr Waddle. ‘You choose, Sam.’ Sam points to Canada.

line.words: L’aula lampeggia – e all’improvviso! - sono trasportati a Canada.

subtitle.line: The classroom flashes – kazam – and they are transported to Canada.
Het klaslokaal flikkert – hocus pocus pilatus pas – en ze zijn in Canada.
Det blinker i klasseværelset – kazam – og de kommer til Canada.
The classroom flashes – kazam – and they are transported to Canada.

line.words: “In qualche parte di Canada come Nova Scotia, ingrassiamo il naso del ragazzo o della ragazzo per renderli troppo scivolosi affinchè la sfortuna non li prenda.” La classe fa finta di ingrassare i nasi.

subtitle.line: ‘Here in some parts of Canada like Nova Scotia, we celebrate Birthdays by greasing the boy or girl´s nose so that they are too slippery for bad luck to catch them.’ The class pretend to grease their noses.

‘In sommige delen van Canada zoals Nova Scotia, vieren we verjaardagen door de neus van de jongen of het meisje in te vetten, zodat hij te glad is om door het ongeluk te pakken te zijn.’ De kinderen uit de klas doen net alsof ze hun neuzen invetten.

“I nogle dele af Canada som her I Nova Scotia, fejrer vi fødselsdag ved at smøre noget fedtet på drengens eller pigens næse, så de er for glatte til at uheld kan ramme dem”. Klassen lader som om de smører fedt på næsen.

‘Here in some parts of Canada like Nova Scotia, we celebrate Birthdays by greasing the boy or girl´s nose so that they are too slippery for bad luck to catch them.’ The class pretend to grease their noses.

line.words: “E ora, dove?” dice Signore Waddle. “Scegli tu Sandrine”. Sandrine indica al Egitto.

subtitle.line: ‘Now where?’ Says Mr Waddle. ‘You choose, Sandrine.’ Sandrine points to Egypt.
‘Waar gaan we nu naartoe?’ vraagt meester Jaap. ‘Kies jij maar, Sandra.’ Sandra kiest Egypte.
“Hvor skal vi så hen?”, siger Mr Waddle. ”Du vælger, Sandrine.” Sandrine peger på Egypten.
‘Now where?’ Says Mr Waddle. ‘You choose, Sandrine.’ Sandrine points to Egypt.

line.words: L’aula lampeggia - e all’improvviso! - sono trasportati al Egitto.

subtitle.line: The classroom flashes – kazam – and they are transported to Egypt.
Het klaslokaal flikkert – hocus pocus pilatus pas – en ze zijn in Egypte.
Det blinker i klasseværelset – kazam – og de kommer til Egypten
The classroom flashes – kazam – and they are transported to Egypt.

line.words: “Qui in Egitto addobbiamo la casa con decorazioni di carta che si chiamano zeena. Facciamo una grande festa con molti amici e famiglia.” La classe fanno zeena con le mani.

subtitle.line: ‘Here in Egypt, we celebrate Birthdays by decorating the house with paper decorations called zeena. We have a big party with lots of friends and family.’ The class make zeena with their hands.
‘Hier in Egypte vieren we verjaardagen door het huis te versieren met zeena’s, papieren versieringen. We geven een groot feest met veel vrienden en familie.’ De klas maakt zeena’s met hun handen.
“Her I Egypten fejrer vi fødselsdag ved at pynte huset med papirdekorationer, der hedder zeena. Vi holder en stor fest med masser af venner og familie”. Klassen laver zeena med hænderne.
‘Here in Egypt, we celebrate Birthdays by decorating the house with paper decorations called zeena. We have a big party with lots of friends and family.’ The class make zeena with their hands.

line.words: “E ora, dove?” dice Signore Waddle. “Scegli tu Harry”. Harry indica a Giappone.

subtitle.line: ‘Now where?’ Says Mr Waddle. ‘You choose, Harry.’ Harry points to Japan.
‘Waar gaan we nu naartoe?’ vraagt meester Jaap. ‘Kies jij maar, Harry.’ Harry kiest Japan.
“Hvor skal vi så hen?”, siger Mr Waddle. ”Du vælger, Harry.” Harry peger på Japan.
‘Now where?’ Says Mr Waddle. ‘You choose, Harry.’ Harry points to Japan.

line.words: L’aula lampeggia – e all’improvviso! - sono trasportati a Giappone.

subtitle.line: The classroom flashes – kazam – and they are transported to Japan.
Het klaslokaal flikkert – hocus pocus pilatus pas – en ze zijn in Japan.
Det blinker i klasseværelset – kazam – og de kommer til Japan.
The classroom flashes – kazam – and they are transported to Japan.

line.words: “Ecco in Giappone festiggiamo il terzo, quinto e settimo compleanno e visitiamo un santuario e preghiamo.

subtitle.line: ‘Here in Japan, we sometimes celebrate the 7th, 5th and 3rd Birthdays by visiting a shrine and praying.
‘Hier in Japan vieren we soms de zevende, vijfde en derde verjaardag door te bidden bij een heiligdom.
“Her I Japan fejrer vi sommetider den 7., 5. og 3. fødselsdag ved at tage til en helligdom og bede.
‘Here in Japan, we sometimes celebrate the 7th, 5th and 3rd Birthdays by visiting a shrine and praying.

line.words: Per ragazzi si fa cosi per il terzo e quinto compleanno e per le ragazze si fa cosi per il terzo e settimo compleanno. Il festiggiato o la festiggiata portano dei nuovi vesiti per l’occasione. I bambini si inginocchiano e pregano.

subtitle.line: For boys it is the 3rd and the 5th Birthday, and for girls it is the 3rd and the 7th birthday. The birthday boy or girl wears new clothes for the occasion.’ The children kneel and pray.

Jongens doen dit bij de derde en vijfde verjaardag, meisjes bij de derde en zevende verjaardag. De jarige draagt nieuwe kleren, special voor de gelegenheid.’ De kinderen doen net alsof ze knielen en bidden.
For drenge er det den 3. og den 5. fødselsdag, og for piger er det den 3. og den 7. fødselsdag. Den dreng eller pige, der fylder år har nyt tøj på i dagens anledning”.Børnene knæler og beder.
For boys it is the 3rd and the 5th Birthday, and for girls it is the 3rd and the 7th birthday. The birthday boy or girl wears new clothes for the occasion.’ The children kneel and pray.

line.words: “Ora andiamo a casa” dice Signore Waddle. L’aula lampeggia – e all’improvviso! - sono trasportati a casa.

subtitle.line: ‘Now let’s return home’ Says Mr Waddle. The classroom flashes – kazam – and they are transported back home.
‘Laten we terug gaan’ zegt meester Jaap. Het klaslokaal flikkert – hocus pocus pilatus pas en ze gaan terug naar Nederland.
“Nu må vi se at komme hjem”, siger Mr Waddle. Det blinker i klasseværelset – kazam – og de kommer hjem.
‘Now let’s return home’ Says Mr Waddle. The classroom flashes – kazam – and they are transported back home.

line.words: E nell’aula ci sono zeena sospesi dal soffitto – e tutti bambini hanno nasi grassi!

subtitle.line: And in their classroom there are ‘zeena’ hanging from the ceiling – and all the children have greasy noses!
In het klaslokaal hangen er plotseling ‘zeena’s’ aan het plafond – en alle kinderen hebben vette neuzen!
Og I klasseværelset hænger der zeena ned fra loftet – og alle børnene har fedtede næser!
And in their classroom there are ‘zeena’ hanging from the ceiling – and all the children have greasy noses!
The end.
The end.
